com.edugility.objexj.engine
Interface ThreadScheduler<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of Object manipulated by Threads scheduled by instances of this class
All Known Implementing Classes:
Thread
public interface ThreadScheduler<T>

An interface indicating that implementations are capable of scheduling Threads.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
Thread

Method Summary
 Thread<T> newThread(Object id, ProgramCounter<T> programCounter, List<? extends T> items, int itemPointer, Map<Object,CaptureGroup<T>> captureGroups, Map<Object,Object> variables)
          Creates a new Thread and returns it.
 boolean schedule(Thread<T> t)
          Schedules the supplied Thread for execution immediately or later.
 

Method Detail

newThread

Thread<T> newThread(Object id,
                    ProgramCounter<T> programCounter,
                    List<? extends T> items,
                    int itemPointer,
                    Map<Object,CaptureGroup<T>> captureGroups,
                    Map<Object,Object> variables)
Creates a new Thread and returns it. Implementations of this method must not return null.

Parameters:
id - the identifier for the new Thread; may be null and used only for its Object.toString() method
programCounter - a non-null ProgramCounter to initialize the new Thread with
items - a possibly null List of items that the new Thread may read from
itemPointer - the starting index within the supplied List of items from which the new Thread will read
captureGroups - any CaptureGroups that the new Thread should start out with; may be null or empty
Returns:
a new non-null Thread

schedule

boolean schedule(Thread<T> t)
Schedules the supplied Thread for execution immediately or later.

Returns:
true if the supplied Thread was scheduled; false otherwise
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if t is null
